p: Several experiments revealed that the methanol and ethanol extracts of O. persica possessed antihyperglycemic action against streptozocin diabetic rats. This was mediated through the stimulation of insulin release, the improvement of the pancreas tissue, the stimulation of glucose utilization in peripheral tissues, the modulation of hormones regulating carbohydrate metabolism, the inhibition of the proximal tubular reabsorption mechanism for glucose in the kidney, and the inhibition of the Î±-glucosidase enzyme [ 235].
